rename.from: AOSP TextToSpeech seems to leak context classes

body:


I wouldn't mind to open a PR to add to the exclusion list. However, I am of two minds whether the case should be added to exclusion list.

My understanding is that exclusion list means "the leak is caused by known bugs in android platform, and there is *nothing* you (app developer) can do about it." In this case, developers *can do* something to workaround the issue, by passing `Application`'s context (instead of `Activity`, `Fragment`, etc.).

What's your thoughts?

Haha that's a good point, this is a great area. As a matter of facts, there are a lot of AOSP leaks that you can work around (e.g. by clearing a static field via reflection or calling a method early and passing the app context so that a class won't end up caching an activity context).

Maybe I need to rephrase the doc, but my approach is "An excluded leak is a leak in AOSP that happens even though you are using the APIs correctly". Does the documentation using an app context here?

Ah, so the issue is not new. I'm fine with adding it to the exclusion list, given the exclusion list has already included many similar cases.

Though as a developer, I would be interested in differentiating between those you can't do anything about, from those with possible workarounds (with possible links to the google bug, github issues with details).

For TextToSpeech case, the doc is silent about the type of context to be used - in fact, I don't know using `Applicaton`'s context is a general workaround for TextToSpeech, or it just works for the subset of the APIs I've used.
That's a good point. Maybe we should replace [Excluded] with [Android Framework leak] and then when you click on it we provide you with a description of the problem and suggested fixes.

issue.title: add TextToSpeech leaks to exclusion list

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
Closes #1210 .

I am not 100% sure it leaks in all Android versions, but it has been the cases in all the versions tested (4.1 - 7.1 ; with a inconclusive result in Android 9 emulator 
as TextToSpeech wasn't working at all.)

issue.title: [Updated] Add TextToSpeech leaks to exclusion list

repository.name: leakcanary
repository.description: A memory leak detection library for Android.

issue.body:
Fixes #1210

Adapts 18cfdd3 (#1213) to the changed codebase
